indications:
Indications superficial malignant and pre-malignant
skin lesions; other malignant disease (section 8.1.3)
name: FLUOROURACIL - PHOTODAMAGE
cautions: Cautions avoid contact with eyes and mucous membranes; caution in handling—irritant to tissues

indications:
Indications 
(From 8.1.3 Antimetabolites: British National Formulary)
Fluorouracil is used to treat a number of solid tumours, including gastro-intestinal tract cancers and breast cancer. It is commonly used with folinic acid in advanced colorectal cancer. It may also be used topically for certain malignant and pre-malignant skin lesions. Toxicity is unusual, but may include myelosuppression, mucositis, and rarely a cerebellar syndrome. On prolonged infusion, a desquamative hand–foot syndrome may occur.; pre-malignant and malignant skin lesions (%s
(From FLUOROURACIL: British National Formulary)
FLUOROURACIL)
name: FLUOROURACIL - ANTIMETABOLITES
cautions: Cautions see section 8.1 and notes above; caution in handling—irritant to tissues; interactions: Appendix 1 (fluorouracil)
side-effects: Side-effects see section 8.1 and notes above; also local irritation with topical preparation
doses:
By intravenous injection or infusion or by intra-arterial
infusion, consult product literature
pregnancy:
Pregnancy avoid (teratogenic); see also Pregnancy and Reproductive
Function

indications:
Indications superficial malignant and pre-malignant
skin lesions; other malignant disease (section 8.1.3)
name: FLUOROURACIL With salicylic acid
cautions: Cautions avoid contact with eyes and mucous membranes; caution in handling—irritant to tissues
doses:
Name[Actikerall® (Almirall) ] Solution, fluorouracil 0.5%, salicylic
acid 10%, net price 25 mL = £38.30. 
    Label:
    15Excipients  none as listed in section 13.1.3Dose low or moderately thick hyperkeratotic actinic keratosis,
apply to affected area once daily for up to 12 weeks; max. area of
skin treated at one time, 25 cm2 (e.g. 5 cm x 5 cm)
